name: Bogey: Foehammer's Blade - Barbarian 16/ Fighter 6/ CoT 18
author: Stagmeister

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
EDIT 27/2/23: I've now played Bogey (so nicknamed by a terribly disrespectful dwarven companion because of his green skin) through to level 40 in the OC and Mines of Twin Summits, and am delighted to say he plays like a dream - with some decent armour and aid to his Will save. Thus, I'm content to move him into the Full Epic forum.

I did amend my original somewhat regarding the skills, in that I dropped Concentration for Spellcraft and popped in a smidgen of Open Lock and Disable Trap. And I've included the shield discussion as well.

I could find only one broadly similar build in the old search engine, and it's by Mithdradates, so probably deserves a mention: Chosen of Tempos v2, who's a human Barbarian 24/ Fighter 6/ CoT 10. In the ECB search engine, there are three similar builds, the closest of which is Tyr Templar's Beowulf, who shares the Barbarian 16/ Fighter 6/ CoT 18 split, but is also human. The other two are from Max, being Champion of the Tribes, a Barbarian 16/ CoT 22/ Rogue 2 who is again human, and Daelan Red-Tiger, a Barbarian 17/ CoT 18/ HS 5 who is the only other half-orc of the bunch. I think Bogey is sufficiently different from all four to claim his own place here.

I hope you'll forgive me, but my melee-brute is on overtime atm.

This time I've gone for a half-orc Barbarian and Champion of Tempus/Tempos, Lord of Battle and God of War. Gelthan Brone has risen to the rank of Rauthat Swordmaster in the hierarchy and member of the Order of the Steel Fang. Tempus Foehammer is concerned with honourable battle, and his credo is simple and direct: 1. Be fearless. 2. Never turn away from a fight. 3. Obey the rules of war.

Tempus' symbol is an upraised sword sheathed in fire on a crimson field, hence the weapon choice, but do adapt should you wish - though I'd keep it one-handed or the AC becomes somewhat shonky, 'specially when raging (if you drop exotic weapons - scimitar would made sense for crits - you could always take IKD or Imp Expertise in its place). I know I sacrifice CON to boost STR, so while his rages won't last as long (or come that often with only 16 levels), he does have Dev Crit (DC 41) and a more than passable AB, so he doesn't really have to rely on them - when he does boil, though, it's bloody scary. I've also boosted his Fortitude for a Dev Crit environment.

I'll build up some proper back-story for him later. In the meantime...
